sense.name: a financial derivative to buy or sell stock, or other things, at fixed price.
sense.examples: The number of options traded on the Big Board has increased dramatically. December options on that company are trading at 14 and a quarter. I bought 100 put options over the Internet on a hot search company. John must exercise his call option by the end of the day, or it will expire.

sense.name: a set of choices or alternatives
sense.commentary: OPTION[+set][+member][+alternative] Note: Can occur in the singular or plural
sense.examples: So what are our options? You have five options in floor covering to choose from. Management's options are to either settle with the union or lose revenue from a strike.

sense.name: the act of choosing, picking one among many
sense.commentary: OPTION[+action][+decision] Note: Occurs only in the singular, refers to an event, not an entity
sense.examples: This option for window treatment was Mary's. John's option of early retirement has worked out well.

sense.name: offensive football play
sense.examples: The halfback dropped the ball before he could make his option play.
